iterations.description: The fix is verified: modifying ConnectionTree.ApplyFilter to call ExpandAll() ensures matching folders expand. Logic to save and restore expansion state prevents losing user context when clearing the filter. Verified with a new UI test case.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: Regarding filtering, this is a known limitation that was accepted during implementation (#338). While it is possible to work around this limitation, it would require re-implementing the entire filtering feature. We are currently just using the built-in filtering provided by [ObjectListView](http://objectlistview.sourceforge.net/cs/index.html).

comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The fix is verified: modifying ConnectionTree.ApplyFilter to call ExpandAll() ensures matching folders expand. Logic to save and restore expansion state prevents losing user context when clearing the filter. Verified with a new UI test case.
Approach: Update ConnectionTree.ApplyFilter to call ExpandAll() to show matches. Add logic to snapshot ExpandedObjects before filtering and restore it in RemoveFilter.
